meanings.definition: Taking words in their usual or most basic sense without metaphor or exaggeration.
meanings.sent1: The book was a literal copy of the original, with no changes made.
meanings.sent2: She always speaks in a literal way, never using any exaggeration.
meanings.sent3: He took her literal words and ran with them, causing a funny misunderstanding.
meanings.sent4: His literal interpretation of the instructions led to an unexpected result.
meanings.sent5: The literal meaning of the phrase was crystal clear to everyone.

meanings.definition: Following the exact words of the original.
meanings.sent1: The literal translation of the text preserved the author's exact words.
meanings.sent2: The contract was a literal copy of the agreement they had made.
meanings.sent3: She followed his literal instructions to the letter, surprising him.
meanings.sent4: His literal adherence to the rules made him a reliable team member.
meanings.sent5: The literal repetition of the melody created a sense of deja vu.
